title: Allman Brothers Band-Seven Turns(1990)320 kbps
description:
The Allman Brothers Band - Seven Turns (1990) 320 kbps
Good Clean Fun (5:09) 
Let Me Ride (4:36) 
Low Down Dirty Mean (5:30) 
Shine It On (4:51) 
Loaded Dice (3:29) 
Seven Turns (5:05) 
Gambler&#039;s Roll (6:44) 
True Gravity (7:58) 
It Ain&#039;t Over Yet (4:54)

The reunited Allman Brothers&#039; first studio album in nine years proved to be one of their strongest sets ever, setting the stage for their &#039;90s resurgence as one of rock&#039;s best live acts. The title song is a folk gospel number with much harmony singing (unusual for the Allmans), while "True Gravity" is a virtuoso instrumental that makes hair-pin turns between two chord blues rock vamps and skittering unison jazz riffs.

Although guitarist Dickie Betts wrote or co-wrote most of the songs, the rest of the material here isn&#039;t at all country-tinged. In fact, this is one of the band&#039;s bluesiest albums ever, from the old-time boogie woogie of "Let Me Ride," to "Low Down Dirty Mean," which begins as minimalist acoustic country blues and ends as a full-bore assault by the entire band. Features Warren Haynes and Allen Woody who went on to form Gov&#039;t Mule.
